project.teaser: “MOTIONAL” will enable the improved planning and operational management of services and offers and is therefore of paramount importance to meet the European ambitious target to make rail the preferred mode of transport in the future. It will enable the future European...
project.objective: “MOTIONAL” will enable the improved planning and operational management of services and offers and is therefore of paramount importance to meet the European ambitious target to make rail the preferred mode of transport in the future. It will enable the future European railway system to be interoperable, resilient, able to adapt capacity and able to integrate all involved services including last mile operations, exploiting the opportunities provided by digitalization. The “MOTIONAL” developments for the future European Traffic Management are key to achieve the foreseen Single European Rail Area. Today, rail traffic is managed on national/regional level supported by legacy systems with a poor level of digitalization and weak integration with systems of other actors participating in the overall traffic planning and management process. Through the development of functional requirements, associated specifications and operational or technological solutions and by taking advantage of the potential of digitalization, “MOTIONAL” will pave the way towards the implementation of the future European Rail Traffic Management System to make rail the backbone of a multimodal transport system for passengers and freight. The planned activities to achieve the objectives of Destination 1 are carried out in two major workstreams. Workstream 1 has the three major focus areas, Planning and Operation activities (dealing with the future interactively linked timetable planning and operational traffic management systems) and Integration activities (dealing with railway services to offer door-to-door mobility). Workstream 2 will deliver a set of digital enablers for all Europe’s Rail Destinations (i.e.“transversal”) to support the development of destination-specific digitalization solutions as Digitalization is a fundamental transformational process encompassing the Rail System as a whole.
project.title: Europe’s Rail Flagship Project 1 - MObility managemenT multImodal envirOnment aNd digitAl enabLers

programme.title: Network management planning and control & Mobility Management in a multimodal environment and Digital Enablers

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

result.title: Data model and format for a harmonised EU planning of railway assets, starting from CCS+
result.description: Provide data model specification for digital engineering of railway assets.

result.title: A 0,1 Linear Programming Approach to Deadlock Detection and Management in Railways

details.authors: Veronica Dal Sasso, Leonardo Lamorgese, Carlo Mannino, Andrea Onofri, Paolo Ventura
details.publisher: Institute for Operations Research and the Management Sciences (INFORMS)

result.title: Use Cases for project demonstrations
result.description: This deliverable provides an overview of the Use Cases for all planned demonstrations in the project.

result.title: Project exploitation strategy
result.description: This report will outline the strategy for all the exploitation activities envisaged during the life of the project. The strategy will be updated when necessary, during the project.

result.title: On the fragility of a train timetable

details.authors: M.L. Tessitore, G. Sartor, M. Samà, C. Mannino, D. Pacciarelli

result.title: Demonstration Strategy
result.description: This deliverable will cover a plan to set up and perform demonstrations, including timeline, alignment, dependencies. The strategy will act as a guideline for the project WPs and provide templates.

result.title: First report on KPI achievements and impact
result.description: First report on impact and KPI achievements based on Table ‘Performance Indicators for WS1’ pf Part B.

result.title: Integration of planning systems
result.description: This report is based on input from activities in tasks 4.1, 4.2, 4,3, 4.4, and 4.5 including the specification of interfaces and detailed use cases.

result.title: Process to collection of use cases and establishing cooperation with all Destinations and System Pillar
result.description: Process describing the systematic acquisition of Use Cases digital models and processes from all FAs; including the requirement capture, synthetization, and allocation to the corresponding executor.

result.title: TMS and ATO/C-DAS timetable test & simulation environment
result.description: This report is based on the input of Tasks 15.4 and 15.5. Development of TMS and ATO/C-DAS timetable test & simulation environment to enable optimisation algorithm, capacity and human-factors research including human factor research methodologies on rating them in this environment.

result.title: Federated data space “Sandbox-Environment” description
result.description: Technical description of federated data space “Sandbox-Environment” describing the technical components, operations and required resources.

result.title: Workplan for collaboration with other EU-RAIL Destinations
result.description: This workplan captures the specific requirements and delivery schedules of this project with other EU-RAIL Destinations. This document will be updated when applicable.

result.title: Report on the description of algorithms for long-term timetabling, short-term timetabling and rolling stock planning
result.description: This deliverable is based on the input from tasks 6.1, 6.2, 6.3 and 6.4 in WP6.

result.title: Developed simulation methods and models for capacity evaluation of ETCS and C-DAS/ATO
result.description: The report is based on input from task 8.4 and describes the developed simulation methods and models for capacity evaluations of ETCS and C-DAS/ATO.

result.title: Operational Wheel Flat Detector in Railway Vehicles

details.authors: Ibon Erdozain, Blas Blanco, Luis Baeza, Asier Alonso
details.journalTitle: Annual Conference of the PHM Society

result.title: Description of metrics and methodology used for assessment of KPI achievements and impact
result.description: This report describes the metrics and methodology to calculate the contribution of project developments to the technical KPIs and the contribution to impacts set in the MAWP. It also includes an initial assessment based on available specifications for technical solutions.

result.title: Specification Report of Enablers 18 - 27
result.description: This deliverable is based on the outcome of tasks 19.1 to 19.9 and includes the high-level design, architecture and use cases for the planned developments. It contains an analysis of available data and summary of the status quo of existing technologies.

result.title: Specification of selected Processes and Communication between applications
result.description: This report is based on the input of Task 11.2. The deliverable presents the specification of processes and communication requirements with regards to data elements needed for an interoperable data exchange addressed within the work package.

result.title: Report: The need for future development of methods and models for capacity simulations and feedback loops between planning and operations
result.description: The report is based on input from task 8.2 and includes research on the need of development of relevant capacity simulation methods and models and feedback loops between planning and operations including TMS-C-DAS/ATO.

result.title: Requirements Specification for Automated Decisions and Decision Support for Traffic Management optimisation
result.description: This report is based on the input of Task 17.1. This deliverable provides a report on the detailed functional, non-functional and operational requirements for Real Time Conflict Identification, Decision Support and automated/semi-automated Resolution. including the criteria for benchmarking of the developed algorithms that shows the suitability of each of the developed algorithms for specific applications.

result.title: Use case specification and requirement specification for disruption management
result.description: This report is based on the input of Tasks 13.5 and 13.6. The report will specify the use cases and the requirements for the DSS for disruption management.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - FP1 - MOTIONAL (Europe’s Rail Flagship Project 1 - MObility managemenT multImodal envirOnment aNd digitAl enabLers)
result.teaser: FP1 MOTIONAL initiative is vital for advancing European railways to meet the ambitious goal of making rail the preferred mode of transport. It aims to enhance planning and operational management, ensuring the European railway system is interoperable, resilient, and adaptable...
result.description: periodic

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Mapping against scope, specification of technical enablers, high-level use cases, high-level requirements, high level design for demonstrators in WPs 11-18
result.description: This report is based on the input of Tasks 10.1 and 10.2. It report identifies sources in previous international projects dealing with TMS development and integration and the trends of the market for such type of projects. Based on the needs of WPs 11, 13, 15, 17, the high-level use cases for future TMS enhancements are presented. And then, based on those and on the assigned requirements, high-level designs for each demonstrator are also shown.

result.title: Developed methods and models for evaluating feedback loops between planning and operations
result.description: The report is based on input from task 8.3 and describes the developed simulation environment for micro and macro simulation and the developed methods for analysing historical data from operations to improve capacity evaluations.

result.title: Project dissemination and communication plan
result.description: This report will outline the plan for all the communication and dissemination activities envisaged during the life of the project. The DC-plan will be updated when necessary, during the project.

result.title: Requirements for the deployment of TMS linked with ATO/C-DAS
result.description: This report is based on the input of Tasks 15.2 and 15.3. It is setting up requirements for innovations in TMS – ATO/C-DAS including relevant and needed state-of-the-art.

result.title: Mapping against scope, specification of technical enablers, high-level use cases, high-level requirements, high level design for demonstrators in WPs 4-9
result.description: This report is based on the input from tasks 3.1, 3.2 and 3.3. It will present high level use cases, requirements and plans for the demonstrators in WS1.1 Planning.

result.title: Use Cases for planned technical developments of the project
result.description: This deliverable provides an overview of the high-level Use Cases of all planned technical developments and an analysis report about data availability in prototype environments.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
